item.title: Request: exp from crystal chest
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

public void crystalkey() { sendMessage("You have opened the crystal chest!"); deleteItem(989,getItemSlot(989),1); addSkillXp(200,0); addSkillXp(200,1); addSkillXp(200,2); addSkillXp(200,3); addSkillXp(200,4); addSkillXp(200,5); addSkillXp(200,6); }

ok the first number 200 is how much exp you add to a certain skill and the numbers 0-6 are the skill number

change them to what you want i didnt test this so yeah

Read full topic

item.title: Request: exp from crystal chest
item.dc:creator: @gho5t gho5t
item.description:
@gho5t wrote:

Ok. So. I dont know if theres already a tut on this, but if anyone can think of a way to make it so when you open the crystal chest, it gives you exp instead of items, and maybe if its possible, you can change the kind of exp you wanna get.

It doesnt seem that hard, but im not that great at voidsâ€¦
This is what the void for opening the chest is like

} public void crystalkey() { sendMessage("You have opened the crystal chest!"); deleteItem(989,getItemSlot(989),1); addItem(1615,1); addItem(Item2.randomCrystal(), 1); }

Im thinking you can just put something like

		addSkillXP(25, 1);

in it, but im not sure what the numbers in it mean, and im really not good with voids.

If anyone can help me out, just please post on here or message me.

Read full topic
